intro: Paragynoxys uribei, commonly known as the Uribé paragynoxys, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Paragynoxys uribei is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
